preqs: Students must have passed ECC2000 or ECC5900 or ECX9000 or ECX5900 before undertaking this unit.

rules.ruleString: Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {ECC5900, ECC9000, ECX5900, ECX9000} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS}

description: Issues include incentives and credibility problems in microeconomic policy making in both developed and developing economies, with particular attention to topics such as microeconomic issues in the public sector, the role of institutions, and the critical evaluation of microeconomic policy. Students are expected to build on basic microeconomics knowledge and to exhibit an understanding of the policy context.
